string-array.name: tips
string-array.item: Welcome to CyanogenMod\n CyanogenMod is a free, community-supported variant of Android. For more tips about the ICS-based CM9, touch this bubble. @drawable/cyanogenmod_icon
CyanogenMod 9\n The CM9 firmware you\'re using is based on Google\'s own version 4.0 (Ice Cream Sandwich), and a derivative of the Android Open Source Project (AOSP) @drawable/cyanogenmod_icon
See all your apps.\n Touch the Launcher icon at the bottom of the screen @drawable/all_apps
Drag apps to your Home screen.\n Touch & hold an app in the Launcher until it vibrates.
Rearrange your Home screen.\n Touch & hold an item and when it vibrates, drag it where you want.
Quickly uninstall an app\n Touch & hold an item in the full app list and when it vibrates, drag it to the upper left corner. The "Cancel" option will become "Uninstall" after 2 seconds.
Remove items.\n Touch & hold an item and when it vibrates, drag it to the "Remove" option at the top. @drawable/trash
Join applications.\n Touch & hold an icon and when it vibrates, drag it on top of another. You now have a folder with those two apps.
Multiple Home screens.\n Swipe left or right to switch. Drag items to other screens.
Done with this widget?\n Touch & hold it and when it vibrates, drag it to the "Remove" option.

string-array.item: Home is a garden \nTouch & hold an empty spot \nTo grow new icons

Status bar icons \nTo discover their secrets \nPull the windowshade
There is a trick to \nDragging items twixt Home screens \nPause at the edges
Touch Market for apps \nLike a box of chocolates \nEach one a surprise
Oh, and by the way: \nCeci n’est pas une trombone \nI am an Android
